blog_articles.title: "What is the Best Payment Gateway in Egypt?" – The Ultimate Guide
blog_articles.description: A comprehensive comparison between Paymob, Kashier, and Fawry Pay to help you choose the right payment gateway for your business in Egypt.
blog_articles.content:
If you have an online business in Egypt, you've certainly reached the chronic headache stage of: "Who should I integrate with to receive my money?". It's confusing; every day there is a new company, and everyone claims to be the best.

In this article, I will give you the complete summary. We will analyze the most famous payment gateways in Egypt in detail, and I will tell you exactly who to choose based on the size of your work, so that after reading this article, you won't be confused again.

**Step One: Defining Your Business Identity (Individual or Company?)**
Before anything else, we must be clear. Are you just starting out and working as an "Individual" (with your national ID), or are you a registered "Company" with a commercial register and tax card? This answer will determine the path you take.

**First: Payment Gateways for Individuals (Freelancers and Startups)**
If you are just starting, you need an easy payment gateway that doesn't require a lot of paperwork and has reasonable fees. In this arena, there are two key players dominating the scene.

**1. Paymob: The Stable Giant**
The Gist: This is arguably the most famous and oldest electronic payment gateway in Egypt. Most large companies trust it. Its reputation for stability and security is excellent, making it a very safe choice for anyone.

Pros:
- All payment methods: They accept Visa, Mastercard, mobile wallets (Vodafone Cash, Orange Money, etc.), and even installments through many banks. This is their biggest competitive advantage.
- Ease of Registration: As an individual, all you need is a copy of your ID and a bank account to start.
- Strong Technical Support: They have a large and organized support team, which is crucial if you face any issues.

Cons:
- Weekly Settlement: Transferring money to your bank account happens once a week.
- Minimum Withdrawal Limit: There is a minimum amount you can withdraw (it was 5000 EGP, this number may change).

Detailed Pricing (Standard Plan):
- Setup or Monthly Fees: None.
- Commission: 2.75% + 3 EGP on every card payment transaction.

For whom? For those who want to start right with a big, trusted name, and don't mind paying slightly higher fees in exchange for stability and the variety of payment methods offered to customers.

**2. Kashier: The Fast and Easy Competitor**
The Gist: Kashier entered the market strongly, focusing on ease and speed. It is excellent for people selling on social media or who don't want technical complexities.

Pros:
- Incredible Ease: Registration is very easy, and their most important feature is "Payment Links" which you can generate and send to any client without even having a website.
- Good Wallet Support: They accept most popular electronic wallets.
- No Minimum Withdrawal: A very strong feature for small projects.

Cons:
- Commission: Very close to Paymob.
- Brand Name: Still not as famous as Paymob among a large segment of customers.

Detailed Pricing:
- Setup or Monthly Fees: None.
- Commission: 2.75% + 3 EGP on every transaction.

For whom? For the person selling on Facebook or Instagram who wants the easiest and fastest way to send a link to a client to pay, without needing technical complexities.

**Second: Payment Gateways for Registered Companies**
If your business has grown and you are a registered company, the options increase, and the features evolve.

Surprise: Paymob and Kashier work with companies too! It is important to know that Paymob and Kashier are not just for individuals. They have pricing plans and packages specifically for large companies (Enterprise), with lower commissions and additional features. So if you started with them as an individual and your business grew, you can easily upgrade your account to a company account and continue with them.

But here, a very heavy player enters the market specifically for companies.

**Fawry Pay: A Name That Means Trust**
The Gist: Fawry is not just a payment gateway; it is a complete payment network and ecosystem in Egypt. When a customer sees the "Fawry" logo on your site, they trust you immediately because it is a name they know and deal with every day.

Pros:
- Trust and Credibility: The biggest name in the Egyptian payments market without dispute.
- Cash Payment: This is the killer feature no one else has with the same strength. The customer can choose "Pay via Fawry" and receive a code to go pay "Cash" at any kiosk or supermarket with a Fawry machine. This opens up a huge segment of customers who do not have Visa cards.
- Integrated Services for Companies: They have advanced solutions like recurring invoices (for subscriptions), installment systems, and payroll services.

Cons:
- Companies Only: You must have a commercial register and tax card.
- Setup and Monthly Fees: Unlike competitors, there are fees you pay even if you don't make a single sale.

Detailed Pricing (Startup Plan for Small Businesses):
- Setup Fees: 999 EGP (paid once).
- Monthly Fees: 499 EGP (monthly minimum; if your commission in a month is less than this amount, you pay it).
- Card Payment Commission: 2.75% + 3 EGP.
- Wallet Payment Commission (QR Code): 1.5% (cheaper than cards).

For whom? For companies and stores with large sales volumes that can bear fixed costs, and companies wanting to reach the customer segment that prefers cash payments.

**Final Conclusion: Who Should I Choose?**
- Just starting (Individual) and need all possible payment methods? Start with **Paymob**.
- Working on Social Media (Individual) and want the fastest, simplest solution? **Kashier** will be an excellent choice.
- Became a company with large sales volume, and want to reach customers who pay cash? Then you must go to **Fawry Pay**.

In the end, there is no such thing as the "best payment gateway" absolutely; there is only the "most suitable payment gateway for you right now". Start with what fits your current size, and when you grow, you can easily change or add another payment gateway.

**Need Help with Implementation? Let's Talk!**
After knowing the difference between payment gateways, the next step is technical implementation and linking this gateway to your website or e-commerce store. If this isn't done correctly, it can cause many problems and lose you sales.

I am Andrew Atef, a freelance developer specializing in building e-commerce stores and integrating them with these payment gateways professionally and securely. If you are still confused or want to know the next steps, I would be happy to offer you a free 15-minute consultation to discuss your project and see the best solution for you.

Send me a message on WhatsApp now to schedule the call: Click here to contact me on WhatsApp
